title: Good for email but calendar is awkward
text: I find the calendar is awkward when setting appointments far into the future like for a dentist.  There is no fast way to set a date other than scrolling forever.

title: Alberto Granados
text: Alberto Granados, padrino de una promoción de EAE, nos dejó el mejor discurso escuchado en nuestras vidas. Dichosos de contar con tan espléndido ser humano y profesional. Sigan adelante y que Dios les bendiga a todo el equipo. Fuerte abrazo al equipo!

title: Microsoft wins…
text: Outlook works flawlessly on both my iPad and my Android devices. It’s a godsend to have a mail client that works reliably. Thanks Microsoft, you’ve come a long way in the arena of enabling cross-platform compatibility and making e-mail accessible.

title: Timezone problem
text: Outlook for the iPhone is not properly calculating time zone changes. I’m in Arizona where we do not change time, and my meetings next week are showing off by 1 hour. Outlook on my Mac shows them properly.

title: Nice app
text: Very easy to use

title: Off the Record
text: Don’t tell Apple but i legit enjoy this app more than the native ‘Mail’ on my iPhone. i can’t even elucidate as to why exactly… just more ‘responsive’ ? better GUI ? i prefer the layout and design and fonts , perhaps ? who knows but i just feel happier using this than any other mail app 😂 so , to the developers of this genuine gem , i say: *bravo* .  Of note: the ::One:: aspect that I feel could use improvement is the speed (of basic commands/swiping/screen-switching)— I did notice that there is a subtle LAG.

title: Needs a few basic integrations…
text: Am I missing something? App installed on my iPad. Shows I can send emails to Microsoft To Do app. Cool. Helpful. Same app on my iPhone - no such integration. I’d really, really like to use and enjoy this app. But until it gets some integrations with even the most basic apps, (not even Microsoft’s! ) it’s just not effective for me.

title: Colored flags like Mac Mail
text: See header

title: Very good app but have 2 suggestions
text:
I have folders created for emails from specific ppl to land there, but when they do the app doesnt tell me i have new emails, so it says 0 in inbox but these new emails landed in the other folder and i dont know i have new emails there until i slide to see the folders from the left side. The other idea is to be able to navigate through the emails w/o having to go back to the list. In other words i open an email and then would like to go to the next email like in mail app. 
Other than that the app works well, its fast, and i live the schedule send feature.

title: Schedule send
text: Hey so your app is fine, does the job the same as other email apps. My one problem would be don’t recommend schedule send during peoples work hours if you ARENT GOING TO SEND THE EMAIL. Yes I would rather not bug people at odd hours but don’t recommend to send my message the next day and then never send it. Happened to me twice, could’ve easily cost me thousands of dollars. Be better you’re a freaking megacorp

title: Changed my outlook on life
text: Game changing. No cap, this is the best!

title: Spam emails
text:
Rating lower due to the amount of spam emails that come through to my inbox on a daily basis. There really needs to be a way to filter these out. I have multiple gmail accounts that are able to move these types of emails to a different folder without my prompting. It gets frustrating to have to constantly clear these out of my focus inbox. 

Other than that the app functions as expected.
